section.title: Polynomial Functions
section.p: We have already encountered some examples of polynomial functions. Linear functions, f (x) = ax + b and quadratic functions f (x) = ax^2 + bx + c are special cases of polynomial functions. In general, we make the following definition.

statement.p: A polynomial function has the form f (x) = a_n x^n + a_{n−1}x^{n−1} + a_{n−2}x^{n−2} + \cdots + a_2x^2 + a_1x + a_0 where a_0, a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n are constants and a_n \ne 0. The coefficient a_n of the highest power term is called the lead coefficient.
